Common Side Effects.Nausea: Mild to moderate nausea, especially during the first few weeks of treatment.
Common Side Effects.Vomiting: Occasional vomiting due to gastrointestinal irritation.
Common Side Effects.Diarrhea: Frequent loose stools due to GI upset.
Common Side Effects.Fatigue: Persistent tiredness or lack of energy.
Common Side Effects.Abdominal Pain: Discomfort or cramping in the stomach area.

Hematologic Side Effects.Leukopenia: Reduction in white blood cells, increasing the risk of infections.
Hematologic Side Effects.Thrombocytopenia: Low platelet count, which may cause easy bruising or bleeding.
Hematologic Side Effects.Anemia: Low red blood cell count, leading to fatigue and pallor.
Hematologic Side Effects.Pancytopenia: Reduction in all blood cell types in severe cases.

Infections.Increased Risk of Infections: Due to immunosuppression, patients are more susceptible to bacterial, viral, and fungal infections.
Infections.Opportunistic Infections: Infections like cytomegalovirus or Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia.

Gastrointestinal Side Effects.Pancreatitis: Inflammation of the pancreas, presenting as severe upper abdominal pain.
Gastrointestinal Side Effects.Mouth Ulcers: Painful sores or ulcers in the mouth.
Gastrointestinal Side Effects.Hepatotoxicity: Liver dysfunction, presenting as jaundice, elevated liver enzymes, or hepatomegaly.

Dermatologic Side Effects.Alopecia: Temporary thinning or loss of hair.

Allergic and Hypersensitivity Reactions.Hypersensitivity Syndrome: A rare but serious reaction with fever, rash, and systemic symptoms.
Allergic and Hypersensitivity Reactions.Fever: Unexplained fever as a sign of drug hypersensitivity.

Long-Term Risks.Malignancies: Increased risk of cancers, particularly non-melanoma skin cancer and lymphomas.
Long-Term Risks.Photosensitivity: Increased sensitivity to sunlight, causing skin burns or irritation.

Rare or Serious Side Effects.Myelosuppression: Severe suppression of bone marrow function.
Rare or Serious Side Effects.Interstitial Lung Disease: Lung inflammation or scarring, leading to breathing difficulties.
